erlref.modulesummary: Utility functions to operate on percept data.

description.p: Utility functions to operate on percept data. These functions should be considered experimental. Behaviour may change in future releases.

func.name: minmax(Data::[{X, Y}]) -> {MinX, MinY, MaxX, MaxY}
func.fsummary: Returns the min and max of a set of 2-dimensional numbers.

desc.p: Returns the min and max of a set of 2-dimensional numbers.

func.name: mean(List::[number()]) -> {Mean, StdDev, N}
func.fsummary: Calculates the mean and the standard deviation of a set of numbers.

desc.p: Calculates the mean and the standard deviation of a set of numbers.

func.name: activities2count(Acts::#activity{}, StartTs::timestamp()) -> Result
func.fsummary: Calculate the resulting active processes and ports during the activity interval.

desc.p: Calculate the resulting active processes and ports during the activity interval. Also checks active/inactive consistency. A task will always begin with an active state and end with an inactive state.

func.name: waiting_activities(Activities::[#activity{}]) -> FunctionList
func.fsummary: Calculates the time, both average and total, that a process has spent in a receive state at specific function.

desc.p: Calculates the time, both average and total, that a process has spent in a receive state at specific function. However, if there are multiple receives in a function it cannot differentiate between them.

func.name: seconds2ts(Seconds::float(), StartTs::{integer(), integer(), integer()}) -> timestamp()
func.fsummary: Calculates a timestamp given a duration in seconds and a starting timestamp.

desc.p: Calculates a timestamp given a duration in seconds and a starting timestamp.

func.name: minmax_activities(Activities::[#activity{}], Count::integer()) -> {integer(), integer()}
func.fsummary: Calculates the minimum and maximum of runnable activites (processes and ports) during the interval of reffered by the activity list.

desc.p: Calculates the minimum and maximum of runnable activites (processes and ports) during the interval of reffered by the activity list.
